intro: Tinus martiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ability to thrive in controlled environments has made it a favored ornamental plant worldwide.
